amendatorysection.chaptername: Cities Of The Second Class And Villages
amendatorysection.para: The expense of erecting, locating, and constructing reservoirs and hydrants for the purpose of fire protection and the expense of constructing and laying water mains, pipes, or such parts thereof as may be just and lawful, may be assessed upon and collected from the property and real estate specially benefited thereby, if any, as a special assessment in such manner as may be provided for the making of special assessments for other public improvements in such cities and villages.

annotation.para: Doubts as to meaning of statutory limitations as applied to special assessments to acquire water system should be determined in favor of taxpayer. Futscher v. City of Rulo, 107 Neb. 521, 186 N.W. 536 (1922).
